extendedIngredients.name: brussels sprouts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved lengthwise (quartered if large)

extendedIngredients.name: canned chickpeas
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed

extendedIngredients.name: fresh ginger
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 to 1 ½ teaspoons grated or minced fresh ginger

extendedIngredients.name: grain blend
extendedIngredients.originalString: rice, quinoa or another grain (for serving)

extendedIngredients.name: green onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bunch green onions, thinly sliced (for garnish)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
low sodium soy sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 ½ tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce or tamari

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or more to taste

recipes.title: Winter Vegetable Teriyaki Stir-Fry

winePairing.pairingText: Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and Chenin Blanc are my top picks for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Pacific Rim Riesling with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Pacific Rim Riesling
productMatches.description: Portraying bright crispness, subtle sweetness and aromas of jasmine, pear and apple, Pacific Rim Riesling exemplifies the harmony of Riesling. The sweetness plays wonderfully with fiery fare (from Thai to Mexican), while the natural acidity stands up to richer foods (from French to German).

recipes.instructions: For the sauce:In a small bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the sauce. Set aside.For the stir-fry:Set a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add in the olive oil. When hot, add in the red onion and cook for about 2 minutes, until it starts to soften. Add in the brussels sprouts and cook for 4 minutes, so they start to soften. Add in the broccoli florets and continue to cook for about 5 to 8 minutes, until the veggies are all tender (but still have a touch of crispness).Add the chickpeas, cashews and sauce (give the sauce a whisk before adding) to the skillet and mix to combine. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring often, until the sauce has thickened. Remove from the heat. Taste and season with salt if desired.Serve the stir-fry with the rice or quinoa and garnish with the green onions.

steps.step: For the sauce:In a small bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the sauce. Set aside.For the stir-fry:Set a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.
Add in the olive oil. When hot, add in the red onion and cook for about 2 minutes, until it starts to soften.
Add in the brussels sprouts and cook for 4 minutes, so they start to soften.
Add in the broccoli florets and continue to cook for about 5 to 8 minutes, until the veggies are all tender (but still have a touch of crispness).
Add the chickpeas, cashews and sauce (give the sauce a whisk before adding) to the skillet and mix to combine. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring often, until the sauce has thickened.
Remove from the heat. Taste and season with salt if desired.
Serve the stir-fry with the rice or quinoa and garnish with the green onions.
